discussion.content:
From CCDA 200-310 Official Cert Guide (page 93):
Campus design factors include the following categories:
■ Network application characteristics: Different application types
■ Infrastructure device characteristics: Layer 2 and Layer 3 switching, hierarchy
■ Environmental characteristics: Geography, wiring, distance, space, power, number of nodes

questions.question_text: What two factors should be considered when deploying an enterprise campus network? (Choose two.)
What network technology consolidates network and storage traffic in the data center?

discussion.content:
From CCDA 200-310 Official Cert Guide (page 145):
The solution is to consolidate both LAN and FC SAN services within a single unified network. The consolidation allows for reduced management points within the network and better utilization of the space, cabling, and power resources. Nexus switches, for example, can provide a unified fabric that supports both Ethernet LAN and Fibre Channel SAN traffic on the same physical network.

questions.question_text: What is the key limitation of using Internet circuits as a backup to a private enterprise WAN?

discussion.content:
I'd be tempted to agree with Prioritization. It'd not suit private VoIP traffic etc
Security is of massive importance, yes absolutely. But it would not be a limitation in this instance surely?

comments.content:
Sorry. Of course C is correct.
From CCDA 200-310 Official Cert Guide (page 263):
WAN Backup over the Internet.
Security is of great importance when you rely on the Internet for network connectivity, so a
secure tunnel using IPsec needs to be deployed to protect the data during transport.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Therefore, performing gap analysis is the most accurate activity that aligns with the purpose of the Prepare phase in PPDIOO.

questions.answer_description:
Prepare Phase -
The Prepare phase establishes organization and business requirements, develops a network strategy, and proposes a high-level conceptual architecture to support the strategy. Technologies that support the architecture are identified. This phase creates a business case to establish a financial justification for a network strategy.
questions.question_text: Which is part of the Prepare phase of PPDIOO?
What phase of Cisco's PPDIOO includes the identification and resolution of issues prior to moving the entire network to production?

comments.content:
From CCDA 200-310 Official Cert Guide (page 15):
As changes are implemented, they are also tested before moving to the Operate phase.

discussion.content: I believe this should be Implementation since optimize occurs after operate and this is prior to production.
